ai-iti53:1.1_0: For this was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti53:2.4_0: Pleasant feeling should be seen as suffering.
ai-iti53:2.5_0: Painful feeling should be seen as a dart.
ai-iti53:2.6_0: Neutral feeling should be seen as impermanent.
ai-iti53:2.7_0: When a mendicant has seen these three feelings in this way,
ai-iti53:2.8_0: they’re called a mendicant who has cut off craving, untied the fetters, and by rightly comprehending conceit has made an end of suffering.”
ai-iti53:3.1_0: “A mendicant who sees pleasure as pain,
ai-iti53:3.3_0: As for that peaceful, neutral feeling:
ai-iti53:4.4_0: is a sage who has gone beyond all attachments.”
ai-iti53:5.1_0: That is what the Buddha has heard.
